c74object.name: fs.squeeze~

attribute.name: style_blend
attribute.digest: Morph between single-band and multi-band operation.
attribute.description: Morphs between single band and multiband operation. Multiband operation has been tuned to provide a flat frequency response with slight mid band attenuation and bass boost, similar to the original OTT. Multiband processing may exceed the Ceiling.

attribute.name: floor_dB
attribute.description: The level at which processing will take place. Anything above this value will be pushed closer to the Ceiling, anything below this level will be unaffected. Very low values can bring up minute details that otherwise might never be heard, which can lead to interesting yet unpredictable results.

attribute.name: transport_bypass
attribute.description: If enabled, Squeeze will be bypassed when Transport stops. This avoids things like noise from hardware or reverb/delay tails coming up to full volume when nothing is playing.

attribute.name: time_ms
attribute.description: Adjusts the release for all envelopes. High values will result in something closer to normalization, low values will result in extreme upward compression, squeezing every last drop from your sounds.

attribute.name: squeeze
attribute.description: Adjusts the amount of processing, similar to a ratio control on a typical compressor.

attribute.name: mix
attribute.digest: Balance between processed and unprocessed signal.
attribute.description: Adjusts the balance between the processed and unprocessed signal.

attribute.name: ceiling_dB
attribute.digest: Target level the processed signal is pushed toward.
attribute.description: The level that the affected audio will be normalized to. Lower values combined with adjusting the Dry/Wet(Mix) allows you to tame the processing, making it more useful in a mixing context. The Ceiling may be exceeded if Style is greater than 1.

c74object.description: An external version of the GMaudio Squeeze 2.0 MaxForLive device that can be used in Max/MSP for personal, research and open source projects.
